summary: This is a declaration by Ren Nathan, a custodian of records for Southwest Airlines Co., certifying compliance with a grand jury subpoena dated January 23, 2010, and attesting to the authenticity of the business records being provided. It is a procedural document related to the production of airline records in response to a subpoena in the Epstein investigation.

persons.name: Ren Nathan
persons.role: Custodian of Records for Southwest Airlines Co.
persons.context: Declarant who certifies the authenticity and proper maintenance of business records being produced in response to a grand jury subpoena.

events.title: Grand Jury Subpoena Issued
events.description: A grand jury subpoena was issued and signed by an Assistant United States Attorney, requesting specified records from Southwest Airlines Co.

events.title: Declaration of Custodian of Records Executed
events.description: Ren Nathan executed this declaration under penalty of perjury, certifying the authenticity of the records provided in response to the 2010 subpoena.

keyFacts: A grand jury subpoena was issued to Southwest Airlines Co. on January 23, 2010, as part of the Epstein investigation.
Ren Nathan, as custodian of records for Southwest Airlines, certified the authenticity of the airline's business records on January 29, 2020.
The declaration complies with Federal Rules of Evidence 902(11) and 803(6) to establish the records as admissible business records.
The document indicates investigators sought travel records from a major commercial airline (Southwest) in relation to the case.
The Assistant United States Attorney who signed the subpoena is redacted in the provided text.
